card_description: A classic animated text effect combining a neon-like glow with a subtle pulsing/scaling animation using only CSS.

card_preview.css: h1.preview-title { color: hsl(217, 100%, 85%); font-family: 'Exo 2', sans-serif; font-size: 1.75rem; animation: card_glow 2s ease-in-out infinite, card_pulse 2s ease-in-out infinite; } @keyframes card_glow { 0%, 100% { text-shadow: 0 0 8px hsl(217, 100%, 65%), 0 0 16px hsl(217, 100%, 65%); } 50% { text-shadow: 0 0 16px hsl(217, 100%, 65%), 0 0 32px hsl(217, 100%, 65%); } } @keyframes card_pulse { 0%, 100% { transform: scale(1); } 50% { transform: scale(1.05); } }

modal_content.text: This effect creates an engaging, animated title using two separate CSS `@keyframes` animations. It's highly effective for headers or key text you want to draw attention to. The glow is achieved using the `text-shadow` property, while the pulse is a simple `transform: scale` animation.
First, define your theme colors using CSS variables for easy customization. The `.animated-title` class applies both animations simultaneously.
